009package Synthetic_Noise;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
013import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.noise.hashing.HashFun;
016import imagingbook.common.noise.perlin.PerlinNoiseGenNd;
017
018/**
019 * This ImageJ plugin creates a new noise image using a N-dim. gradient noise 
020 * generator. Several parameters can be adjusted. For details see
021 * Ch. 8 of W. Burger and M. J. Burge. "Principles of Digital Image Processing -
022 * Advanced Methods" (Vol. 3). Undergraduate Topics in Computer Science.
023 * Springer-Verlag, London (2013). https://www.imagingbook.com
024 * 
025 * TODO: NOT WORKING! Needs to be fixed, results are not plausible!
026 * 
027 * @author W. Burger
028 * @version 2013/05/28
029 */
030
031public class Demo_Perlin_Nd  implements PlugIn {
032        
033        static int w = 300;
034        static int h = 300;
035        static int octaves = 3;
036        static int seed = 2;
037
038        static double f_min = 0.01; // f_max / (1 << (octaves-1));
039        static double f_max = f_min * (1 << (octaves-1));
040        
041        static double persistence = 0.5;
042
043        String title = this.getClass().getSimpleName() + " Seed=" + seed;
044        
045        public void run(String arg0) {
046                int dim = 2;    // number of dimensions
047                
048                // choose hash function:
049                HashFun hf = HashFun.create(seed);
050//              HashFun hf = new Hash32Shift(seed);
051//              HashFun hf = new Hash32ShiftMult(seed);
052//              HashFun hf = new Hash32Ward(seed);
053//              HashFun hf = new HashPermute(seed); 
054
055                // create the noise generator:
056                PerlinNoiseGenNd png = new PerlinNoiseGenNd(dim, f_min, f_max, persistence, hf);
057                createNoiseImage(w, h, png).show();
058        }
059        
060        ImagePlus createNoiseImage(int w, int h, PerlinNoiseGenNd ng) {
061                ImageProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(w,h);
062                double[] X = new double[2];
063                for (int v=0; v<h; v++){
064                        for (int u=0; u<w; u++){
065                                X[0] = u;
066                                X[1] = v;
067                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) ng.NOISE(X));
068                        }
069                }
070                fp.setMinAndMax(-0.6,0.6);      //fp.resetMinAndMax();
071                ImagePlus nimg = new ImagePlus(title,fp);
072                return nimg;
073        }
074
075}
